name: Aerospace Engineering (BS)
description: Explore the science and engineering behind air and space flight, including propulsion, aerodynamics, systems engineering, and structural mechanics. This program prepares students for careers in aerospace design, research, and innovation.

name: Aerospace Engineering and Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Combine technical aerospace training with core business knowledge to prepare for leadership roles in aviation and space industries. Offered as part of the Management, Entrepreneurship, & Technology (MET) program.

name: African American Studies (BA)
description: Study the history, culture, and social structures of African Americans and the broader African diaspora through an interdisciplinary lens, including literature, politics, sociology, and history.

name: American Studies (BA)
description: Engage in interdisciplinary study of American culture, institutions, and society. The program encourages customized thematic concentrations like gender, race, politics, and media.

name: Analytics (Minor)
description: Gain essential skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational tools. This program is ideal for students seeking quantitative insight in any discipline.

name: Ancient Greek and Roman Studies (BA)
description: Delve into the languages, literature, philosophy, and history of ancient Greece and Rome. The program emphasizes critical reading and cultural analysis.

name: Anthropology (BA)
description: Explore human cultures, evolution, and social practices across time. This major includes biological, archaeological, linguistic, and sociocultural anthropology.

name: Applied Language Studies (Minor)
description: Focus on the application of linguistic theory to real-world language use, including language acquisition, multilingualism, and educational policy.

name: Applied Mathematics (BS)
description: Develop a strong mathematical foundation with applications in physical, biological, and social sciences. Customize your coursework to suit engineering, data science, or economics.

name: Arabic (Minor)
description: Build proficiency in Arabic language and study its literature and culture. The program emphasizes reading, speaking, and understanding of Arab societies.

name: Architecture (BA)
description: Study the design, theory, and history of the built environment. This pre-professional program prepares students for graduate study in architecture and urban planning.

name: Armenian Studies (Minor)
description: Explore Armenian language, history, and culture, with an emphasis on diaspora studies, literature, and national identity.

name: Art History (BA)
description: Investigate the visual arts across cultures and eras. Develop skills in critical analysis, historical context, and visual literacy.

name: Art Practice (BA)
description: Combine studio art training with critical theory. Learn drawing, painting, digital media, and sculpture while developing your artistic voice.

name: Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies (BA)
description: Study the histories, experiences, and cultural expressions of Asian Americans and the Asian diaspora with an emphasis on social justice and identity.

name: Astrophysics (BA)
description: Examine the structure, formation, and evolution of astronomical objects and systems. The BA track emphasizes flexibility and interdisciplinary study.

name: Astrophysics (BS)
description: A rigorous scientific study of the cosmos, preparing students for graduate research in astronomy, physics, and related fields through math and data-intensive training.

name: Atmospheric Science (BS)
description: Understand weather, climate, and atmospheric processes through physics, chemistry, and environmental science. Prepare for careers in meteorology, policy, or research.

name: Bioengineering (BS)
description: Bridge biology and engineering to develop technologies for healthcare, research, and the environment. Areas include biomechanics, medical imaging, and synthetic biology.

name: Bioengineering and Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Merge engineering and business education to tackle biotechnology challenges with innovation and entrepreneurship, through the MET program.

name: Bioengineering/Materials Science and Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Study the interface of biological systems and materials science, focusing on biomaterials, tissue engineering, and device development.

name: Buddhist Studies (Minor)
description: Explore Buddhist traditions across Asia through philosophy, art, literature, and religious studies. Suitable for students in humanities or global studies.

name: Business Administration (BA)
description: Prepare for leadership in the global economy. Learn finance, marketing, strategy, and organizational behavior through Berkeley Haas’s top-ranked program.

name: Celtic Studies (BA)
description: Immerse in the languages, literature, and history of Celtic-speaking cultures, including Irish, Welsh, and Scottish Gaelic traditions.

name: Chemical Biology (BS)
description: Integrate chemistry and biology to study molecular interactions in living systems. Ideal for pre-med students or those pursuing research in biotechnology.

name: Chemical Engineering (BS)
description: Apply chemistry, math, and physics to design processes for chemicals, fuels, pharmaceuticals, and materials. Prepare for industry or graduate research.

name: Chemical Engineering / Materials Science & Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Explore both chemical and materials engineering to work at the cutting edge of nanotech, energy, and manufacturing.

name: Chemical Engineering / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Combine chemical and nuclear engineering principles for applications in energy systems, safety engineering, and reactor design.

name: Chemistry (BA)
description: Gain foundational training in chemistry with flexibility to pursue interdisciplinary interests or education-related careers.

name: Chemistry (BS)
description: Designed for students pursuing careers in chemistry research or graduate study, this intensive program covers analytical, physical, organic, and inorganic chemistry.

name: Chicanx Latinx Studies (BA)
description: Explore the cultural, historical, and social experiences of Chicanx and Latinx communities through interdisciplinary coursework, including history, literature, sociology, and cultural studies.

name: Chinese Language (BA)
description: Develop advanced proficiency in Chinese language and explore linguistic, literary, and cultural dimensions of Greater China through immersive study.

name: City Planning (BA)
description: Study urban design, public policy, and infrastructure solutions to address the social, economic, and environmental challenges of cities and communities.

name: Civil Engineering (BS)
description: Design and analyze infrastructure systems, including transportation, water resources, structural components, and geotechnical engineering.

name: Civil Engineering and Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Combine civil engineering fundamentals with business skills through the MET program, preparing students for leadership in engineering firms and infrastructure projects.

name: Climate Science (BS)
description: Investigate climate systems, global change, and environmental impacts through quantitative tools in atmospheric science, oceanography, and modeling.

name: Cognitive Science (BA)
description: Examine the science of mind and intelligence through interdisciplinary study in psychology, linguistics, neuroscience, and computer science.

name: Comparative Literature (BA)
description: Study literature across languages and cultures to understand global narratives, literary traditions, and critical theory.

name: Computer Science (BS)
description: Learn systems, algorithms, programming languages, and theory for software development, computing systems, and data-driven applications.

name: Computer Science (BA)
description: Explore computing through a liberal arts lens, combining core CS courses with flexibility in humanities and interdisciplinary studies.

name: Conservation and Resource Studies (BA)
description: Analyze environmental stewardship, natural resource use, and sustainability through ecological, social, and policy perspectives.

name: Course Threads (BA)
description: Follow curated, interdisciplinary 'threads' of courses across departments to study emerging topics like data, health, global studies, or creativity.

name: Creative Writing (BA)
description: Develop voice and skill in fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, and screenwriting under mentorship from faculty and visiting writers.

name: Dance and Performance Studies (BA)
description: Immerse in the theory, history, and practice of dance and performance, with opportunities in choreography, research, and performance projects.

name: Data Science (BS)
description: Train in statistical methods, machine learning, and computational tools for analyzing and interpreting large-scale data in science and business.

name: Demography (BA)
description: Study population dynamics, fertility, mortality, migration, and social implications through quantitative and social science methods.

name: Digital Humanities (BA)
description: Integrate computational methods with humanities inquiry to explore digital text, cultural artifacts, and historical datasets.

name: Disability Studies (BA)
description: Examine disability through social, cultural, and policy lenses, advocating for equity, rights, and inclusion in society.

name: Dutch Studies (BA)
description: Learn Dutch language, literature, history, and culture within an interdisciplinary European studies context.

name: EECS & Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Combine EECS coursework with core business principles through MET, preparing for tech leadership in engineering and management.

name: EECS / Materials Science & Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Combine electrical and materials engineering to design advanced devices, nanotechnology, and semiconductor systems.

name: EECS / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Explore applications at the intersection of electronic and nuclear engineering, including nuclear instrumentation and systems.

name: Earth and Planetary Science (BS)
description: Study geological, atmospheric, and planetary processes to understand Earth’s structure, resources, and planetary evolution.

name: East Asian Humanities (BA)
description: Investigate East Asian cultures through history, literature, philosophy, and arts, with opportunities to study multiple languages.

name: East Asian Religion, Thought and Culture (BA)
description: Examine the religious and philosophical traditions of East Asia, including Buddhism, Confucianism, Taoism, and modern thought.

name: East European/Eurasian Languages & Cultures (BA)
description: Study the languages, literatures, history, and cultural practices of Eastern Europe and Eurasia.

name: Economics (BA)
description: Learn microeconomics, macroeconomics, and econometrics with applications in public policy, business, and international economics.

name: Ecosystem Management & Forestry (BS)
description: Blend ecology, resource management, and conservation to prepare for careers in forestry, environmental consulting, and policy.

name: Education (BA)
description: Explore the foundations of teaching, learning, and educational systems. This interdisciplinary program prepares students for careers in education policy, research, or K-12 teaching pathways.

name: Electrical Engineering & Computer Sciences (BS)
description: Delve into both hardware and software through intensive training in circuits, computing, machine learning, and digital systems—ideal for aspiring engineers and researchers.

name: Electronic Intelligent Systems (Minor)
description: Focus on smart device systems, IoT, and intelligent circuits. This minor is designed for students interested in the intersection of electronics and artificial intelligence.

name: Energy Engineering (BS)
description: Prepare to innovate in renewable energy, sustainability, and thermodynamic systems. This major emphasizes practical solutions to global energy challenges.

name: Energy and Resources (Minor)
description: Interdisciplinary minor covering ecological economics, policy, and sustainability practices. A great complement for majors in engineering, policy, or environmental studies.

name: Engineering Mathematics and Statistics (BS)
description: Combines applied mathematics with statistical modeling to solve engineering problems, particularly in design, control, and decision systems.

name: Engineering Physics (BS)
description: A rigorous program integrating advanced physics with core engineering concepts—ideal for those planning to pursue graduate studies or research careers.

name: English (BA)
description: Analyze literature from diverse periods and cultures while developing strong analytical and writing skills. Great for careers in publishing, law, and education.

name: Entrepreneurship & Technology (Minor)
description: Designed for innovators, this minor focuses on building startups, managing innovation, and navigating the tech industry.

name: Environmental Design & Urbanism in Developing Countries (Minor)
description: Examine design and urban development through a global lens, with focus on sustainability, equity, and infrastructure in the Global South.

name: Environmental Earth Science (BS)
description: Focuses on Earth’s physical processes, such as climate, soil, and groundwater systems, and prepares students for environmental problem-solving careers.

name: Environmental Economics and Policy (BS)
description: Train in microeconomics and policy analysis to tackle environmental challenges. Students gain skills in economic modeling and sustainability.

name: Environmental Engineering (BS)
description: Solve pollution, water, and waste issues through engineering solutions rooted in environmental science and public health.

name: Environmental Engineering Science (BS)
description: A multidisciplinary program integrating biology, chemistry, and physics to engineer environmental systems and sustainability solutions.

name: Environmental Sciences (BA)
description: Explore the scientific basis of environmental issues including biodiversity, water systems, and climate change with social and policy integration.

name: Ethnic Studies (BA)
description: Investigate the histories, cultures, and politics of racially marginalized groups in the U.S. through interdisciplinary study.

name: Film & Media (BA)
description: Study the history, theory, and practice of film and media arts. A path for future filmmakers, critics, and media scholars.

name: Food Systems (Minor)
description: Examine the interconnected components of food production, distribution, and consumption from ecological, economic, and ethical perspectives.

name: French (BA)
description: Gain fluency in the French language and explore Francophone literature, cinema, and culture from medieval to modern times.

name: Gender and Women's Studies (BA)
description: Analyze gender dynamics, feminist theory, and intersectionality across disciplines. Ideal for students pursuing careers in advocacy, law, or academia.

name: Genetics and Plant Biology (BS)
description: Study plant biology, genomics, and biotechnology for careers in agriculture, environmental science, or bioengineering.

name: Geography (BA)
description: Explore human and physical geography, including topics like urbanization, climate change, and geopolitical borders.

name: Geology (BA)
description: Examine Earth’s structure, processes, and history through fieldwork and lab science—great for careers in energy, mining, or research.

name: Geophysics (BS)
description: Apply physics to Earth’s structure and processes. Learn seismic imaging, tectonics, and resource exploration techniques.

name: Geospatial Information Science and Technology (Minor)
description: Learn spatial data analysis, mapping, and remote sensing—an essential skill set in environmental science, urban planning, and policy.

name: Geotechnical Engineering (BS)
description: Focus on soil and rock mechanics in the context of infrastructure design. A specialization within civil engineering.

name: German (BA)
description: Study German language, literature, and culture with focus on both historical and contemporary perspectives.

name: Global Poverty and Practice (Minor)
description: Engage in hands-on work addressing poverty, inequality, and global development through interdisciplinary study and field practice.

name: Global Studies (BA)
description: Examine global systems, international relations, and transnational movements through political, cultural, and economic lenses.

name: Greek (BA)
description: Develop fluency in classical Greek and explore the literature, history, and philosophy of ancient Greece.

name: Greek and Latin (BA)
description: Combine classical studies of Greek and Latin texts with training in ancient history, linguistics, and cultural analysis.

name: Health and Wellness (Minor)
description: Covers mental, physical, and social health. Ideal for students interested in public health, education, or counseling.

name: Hebrew (BA)
description: Focus on the Hebrew language and its literary, cultural, and historical contexts, both ancient and modern.

name: Hispanic Languages, Linguistics, and Bilingualism (BA)
description: Explore Spanish and Portuguese languages, dialects, and sociolinguistics in bilingual and multilingual settings.

name: History (BA)
description: Analyze historical events, cultures, and political systems across global regions and time periods. Prepares students for careers in law, education, or research.

name: History of the Built Environment (Minor)
description: Study architectural and urban development through historical, cultural, and environmental frameworks.

name: Human Rights Interdisciplinary (Minor)
description: Investigate human rights theory and practice through politics, law, anthropology, and literature.

name: Industrial Engineering & Operations Research (BS)
description: Learn mathematical modeling, optimization, and systems analysis for manufacturing, logistics, and service operations. Ideal for careers in analytics and systems engineering.

name: Industrial Engineering & Operations Research & Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Combine IEOR technical training with core business concepts via the MET program, preparing for leadership roles in industry and consulting.

name: Integrative Biology (BS)
description: Explore biological systems from molecules to ecosystems, integrating genetics, ecology, and physiology through coursework and research.

name: Interdisciplinary Studies (BA)
description: Design your own curriculum across multiple disciplines, encouraging exploration of diverse academic interests and creative problem-solving.

name: Israel Studies (Minor)
description: Study the history, culture, society, and politics of Israel through interdisciplinary approaches in humanities, social sciences, and languages.

name: Italian Studies (BA)
description: Learn the Italian language and explore Italy’s literature, film, art, and history from medieval to contemporary periods.

name: Japanese Language (BA)
description: Develop proficiency in Japanese along with study of its literature, society, and culture through immersive coursework.

name: Jewish Studies (BA)
description: Engage with Jewish history, religion, culture, and contemporary issues via an interdisciplinary program spanning humanities and social sciences.

name: Journalism (BA)
description: Learn reporting, multimedia storytelling, and journalism ethics. Prepare for careers in news, digital media, and communications.

name: Korean Language (BA)
description: Gain proficiency in Korean language and explore Korean literature, film, history, and contemporary culture.

name: Landscape Architecture (BA)
description: Study design of outdoor spaces, environmental planning, and sustainable landscapes with a focus on equity, ecology, and aesthetics.

name: Latin (BA)
description: Read and interpret Latin texts from antiquity to the Renaissance, with studies in linguistics, history, and classical culture.

name: Legal Studies (BA)
description: Examine law, legal institutions, and social justice through interdisciplinary lenses including politics, sociology, and philosophy.

name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, & Transgender Studies (BA)
description: Explore LGBTQ histories, theories, and identities through critical study of gender, culture, and sexuality.

name: Life Sciences, Business, and Entrepreneurship (BS)
description: Bridge life sciences with business skills to develop entrepreneurial ventures in biotech, healthcare, and life sciences industries.

name: Linguistics (BA)
description: Study the scientific analysis of language structure and use, covering phonetics, syntax, semantics, psycholinguistics, and sociolinguistics.

name: Logic (BA)
description: Explore formal logic, reasoning, and language through philosophical and mathematical perspectives.

name: Marine Science (BS)
description: Investigate ocean and coastal systems, marine ecology, and environmental science through fieldwork and laboratory study.

name: Materials Science & Engineering (BS)
description: Explore materials from metals to ceramics and biomaterials; study their design, properties, and applications.

name: Materials Science & Engineering / Mechanical Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Integrate materials science and mechanical engineering to innovate advanced structures and manufacturing systems.

name: Materials Science & Engineering / Nuclear Engineering Joint Major (BS)
description: Combine materials engineering with nuclear engineering principles for research and applications in energy and materials performance.

name: Materials Science & Engineering and Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Merge MSE technical training with business strategy and management through the MET program for industry leadership.

name: Mathematics (BS)
description: Acquire a strong theoretical and applied mathematics foundation, suitable for careers in research, finance, or data science.

name: Mechanical Engineering (BS)
description: Study mechanics, thermodynamics, and design to engineer mechanical systems and devices across industries.

name: Mechanical Engineering & Business Administration (BS MET)
description: Integrate mechanical engineering with business education through MET to prepare for leadership in engineering firms.

name: Mechanical Engineering / Nuclear Engineering (BS)
description: Combine mechanical and nuclear engineering skills to work on nuclear systems, energy, and safety applications.

name: Media Studies (BA)
description: Explore the production, consumption, and cultural impact of media across film, digital platforms, and interactive formats.

name: Medieval Studies (BA)
description: Examine medieval Europe through literature, history, art, and languages in an interdisciplinary framework.

name: Microbial Biology (BS)
description: Study microbial life and its roles in health, environment, and biotechnology through molecular, ecological, and genomic approaches.

name: Middle Eastern Languages & Cultures (BA)
description: Learn Middle Eastern languages and examine cultural, historical, and literary contexts of the region.

name: Molecular Environmental Biology (BS)
description: Blend molecular biology with environmental science to study ecosystem functions, environmental health, and biotechnology.

name: Molecular and Cell Biology (BS)
description: Dive deep into cellular systems, genetics, protein function, and biotechnology—preparing for research or medical pathways.

name: Music (BA)
description: Develop performance, composition, and music theory skills while studying music history and ethnomusicology.

name: Native American Studies (BA)
description: Study the histories, cultures, sovereignty, and contemporary issues of Native American communities through interdisciplinary research.

name: Neuroscience (BS)
description: Investigate the structure and function of the nervous system at molecular, cellular, and behavioral levels.

name: New Media (BA)
description: Explore transmedia storytelling, digital arts, and interactive design in contemporary cultural landscapes.

name: Nuclear Engineering (BS)
description: Study nuclear systems, radiation, reactor design, and nuclear safety for energy and research applications.

name: Nutritional & Metabolic Biology (BS)
description: Understand human metabolism and nutrition through molecular and physiological coursework, preparing for health-related careers.

name: Nutritional Sciences: Physiology & Metabolism (BS)
description: Focus on physiological processes related to nutrition and metabolism, integrating research methods and health sciences.

name: Nutritional Sciences: Toxicology (BS)
description: Study the effects of toxins and chemicals on metabolic systems, with applications in public health, research, and regulation.

name: Persian (BA)
description: Develop fluency in Persian and explore the literature, history, and cultural traditions of Iran and wider Persianate regions.

name: Philosophy (BA)
description: Engage with major philosophical traditions and develop critical thinking in ethics, metaphysics, logic, and political philosophy.

name: Physics (BS)
description: Study fundamental physical laws, experimental methods, and theoretical frameworks across classical and modern physics.

name: Planetary Science (BS)
description: Investigate planetary systems, including geology, atmospheres, and astrobiology for Earth and extraterrestrial planets.

name: Political Economy (BA)
description: Analyze economics, politics, and social systems to understand public policy, global inequality, and institutional behavior.

name: Political Science (BA)
description: Study the theory and practice of politics, government systems, and policy making, with global and comparative perspectives.

name: Politics, Philosophy, and Law (BA)
description: Interdisciplinary program exploring legal systems, moral reasoning, political theory, and constitutional law.

name: Portuguese Language, Literature, & Cultures (BA)
description: Learn Portuguese and explore Lusophone literature, culture, history, and contemporary issues.

name: Pre‑Med / Pre‑Health (Other)
description: A pre-professional track providing coursework in biology, chemistry, and health sciences to prepare for medical and health-related careers.

name: Prelaw Information (Other)
description: A structured advising program that prepares students with coursework and resources for law school application.

name: Professional Accountancy (BS)
description: Focuses on accounting theory and practice, preparing students for careers in public accounting, auditing, and finance.

name: Psychology (BA)
description: Study the scientific basis of behavior, cognition, and emotion through research methods in psychology, neuroscience, and development.

name: Public Health (BA)
description: Explore population health, epidemiology, health policy, and social determinants of health to promote community well-being.

name: Public Policy (BA)
description: Combine economics, political science, and statistics to analyze and evaluate public policies at local, national, and global levels.

name: Race and the Law (BA)
description: Examine the intersections of race, law, and justice through historical and contemporary lenses, preparing for social advocacy.

name: Rhetoric (BA)
description: Study persuasion, argumentation, and discourse across public speaking, media, and cultural contexts.

name: Russian Culture (BA)
description: Explore Russian literature, film, art, and social history from the imperial to contemporary era.

name: Russian Language (BA)
description: Develop advanced Russian language proficiency while studying linguistic, cultural, and literary traditions.

name: Russian Literature (BA)
description: Analyze Russian literary masterpieces from Tolstoy to contemporary authors within their cultural and historical contexts.

name: Scandinavian (BA)
description: Study Scandinavian languages, literatures, and cultures with emphasis on Nordic history and social systems.

name: Science and Math Education (BA)
description: Prepare for teaching STEM subjects through coursework in pedagogy, educational psychology, and curriculum development.

name: Science, Technology, and Society (BA)
description: Examine how science and technology shape societies and vice versa, integrating perspectives from history, sociology, and ethics.

name: Science, Technology, and Society (Minor)
description: A focused minor exploring STS concepts, ideal for students majoring in science, humanities, or social studies.

name: Slavic Languages and Literatures (BA)
description: Explore Slavic languages and texts from Russia, Eastern Europe, and the Balkans through literature, culture, and history.

name: Social & Cultural Factors in Environmental Design (BA)
description: Study the social dimensions of environmental design including cultural impact, equity, and participatory planning.

name: Social Welfare (BA)
description: Learn about social policies, community programs, and advocacy to address poverty, inequality, and social services.

name: Society and Environment (BA)
description: Investigate the relationship between human societies and the environment through interdisciplinary study in policy and ecology.

name: Sociology (BA)
description: Analyze social behavior, institutions, and inequality through empirical research in social theory, crime, and family studies.

name: South and Southeast Asian Studies (BA)
description: Study cultures, histories, and languages of South and Southeast Asia through interdisciplinary coursework.

name: Spanish Languages, Literatures, & Cultures (BA)
description: Learn Spanish and explore Hispanic literatures, film, cultural histories, and language diversity.

name: Spanish and Portuguese (BA)
description: Study both Spanish and Portuguese languages and literatures with comparative perspectives on Iberian and Latin American cultures.

name: Statistics (BS)
description: Acquire rigorous training in probability, statistics, and data analysis for applications in science, business, and policy.

name: Structural Engineering (BS)
description: Study how to design safe and efficient structures using principles of mechanics, materials, and seismic analysis.

name: Sustainable Business and Policy (BA)
description: Interdisciplinary approach to business and policy solutions that address environmental and social sustainability.

name: Sustainable Design (BA)
description: Explore design practices that promote sustainability in architecture, products, and systems through theory and studio projects.

name: Sustainable Environmental Design (BA)
description: Study sustainable design of buildings, communities, and landscapes with emphasis on resilience and ecological systems.

name: Teaching English to Multilingual Students (BA)
description: Learn methods for teaching English to multilingual learners with focus on linguistics, pedagogy, and cultural competence.

name: Theater and Performance Studies (BA)
description: Study theater history, performance theory, and practice. Opportunities in acting, directing, and playwriting.

name: Tibetan (BA)
description: Study Tibetan language, literature, and culture, with attention to Buddhist texts and Himalayan traditions.

name: Turkish (BA)
description: Develop proficiency in Turkish and explore literary, cultural, and historical contexts of Turkey and Turkic societies.

name: Urban Studies (BA)
description: Examine urbanization, planning, and social processes in cities through policy, design, and geographic approaches.
